ceilometer.description: If selected, Ceilometer and Aodh components will be installed
ceilometer.label: Install Ceilometer and Aodh

murano_glance_artifacts_plugin.description: If selected glance artifact repository will be enabled
murano_glance_artifacts_plugin.label: Enable glance artifact repository

murano-cfapi.description: If selected, Murano service broker will be installed
murano-cfapi.label: Install Murano service broker for Cloud Foundry

murano.description: If selected, Murano component will be installed
murano.label: Install Murano

sahara.description: If selected, Sahara component will be installed
sahara.label: Install Sahara

restrictions.cluster:net_provider != 'neutron' or net: Ironic requires Neutron with VLAN segmentation.

restrictions.settings:storage.images_ceph.value == tr: Ironic requires Swift or RadosGW for Glance images.

ironic.description: If selected, Ironic component will be installed
ironic.label: Install Ironic

mongo.description: If selected, You can use external Mongo DB as ceilometer backend
mongo.label: Use external Mongo DB

uca_openstack_release.description: This is the named release for the UCA packages (kilo, liberty, etc)
uca_openstack_release.label: UCA OpenStack Release

repos.description:
Please note: the first repository will be considered the operating system mirror that will be used during node provisioning.
To create a local repository mirror on the Fuel master node, please follow the instructions provided by running "fuel-createmirror --help" on the Fuel master node.
Please make sure your Fuel master node has Internet access to the repository before attempting to create a mirror.
For more details, please refer to the documentation (https://docs.mirantis.com/openstack/fuel/fuel-9.0/operations.html#external-ubuntu-ops).

pin_ceph.description: Use Fuel Ceph packages instead of upstream
pin_ceph.label: Ceph APT Pinning

uca_repo_url.description: This the url to the repository hosting the UCA packages
uca_repo_url.label: URL to UCA repository

pin_rabbitmq.description: Use Fuel RabbitMQ packages instead of upstream
pin_rabbitmq.label: RabbitMQ APT Pinning

pin_haproxy.description: Use Fuel HAProxy packages instead of upstream
pin_haproxy.label: HAProxy APT Pinning

auto_assign_floating_ip.description: If selected, OpenStack will automatically assign a floating IP to a new instance
auto_assign_floating_ip.label: Auto assign floating IP

use_cow_images.description: For most cases you will want qcow format. If it's disabled, raw image format will be used to run VMs. OpenStack with raw format currently does not support snapshotting.
use_cow_images.label: Use qcow format for images

auth_key.description: Public key(s) to include in authorized_keys on deployed nodes
auth_key.label: Public Key

puppet_debug.description: Debug puppet logging mode provides more information, but requires more disk space.
puppet_debug.label: Puppet debug logging

values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on hardware
values.label: KVM

values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on virtual hosts.
values.label: QEMU

resume_guests_state_on_host_boot.description: Whether to resume previous guests state when the host reboots. If enabled, this option causes guests assigned to the host to resume their previous state. If the guest was running a restart will be attempted when nova-compute starts. If the guest was not running previously, a restart will not be attempted.
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot.label: Resume guests state on host boot

debug.description: Debug logging mode provides more information, but requires more disk space.
debug.label: OpenStack debug logging

task_deploy.description: The new deployment engine based on cross-node dependencies for deployment tasks.
task_deploy.label: Enable task based deploy

nova_quota.description: Quotas are used to limit CPU and memory usage for tenants. Enabling quotas will increase load on the Nova database.
nova_quota.label: Nova quotas

assign_to_all_nodes.description: When disabled, public network will be assigned to controllers only
assign_to_all_nodes.label: Assign public network to all nodes

volumes_ceph.description: Configures Cinder to store volumes in Ceph RBD images.
volumes_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for volumes (Cinder)

objects_ceph.description: Configures RadosGW front end for Ceph RBD. This exposes S3 and Swift API Interfaces. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
objects_ceph.label: Ceph RadosGW for objects (Swift API)

volumes_block_device.description: High performance block device storage. It is recommended to have at least one Cinder Block Device
volumes_block_device.label: Cinder Block device driver

ephemeral_ceph.description: Configures Nova to store ephemeral volumes in RBD. This works best if Ceph is enabled for volumes and images, too. Enables live migration of all types of Ceph backed VMs (without this option, live migration will only work with VMs launched from Cinder volumes).
ephemeral_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for ephemeral volumes (Nova)

volumes_lvm.description: It is recommended to have at least one Cinder node.
volumes_lvm.label: Cinder LVM over iSCSI for volumes

restrictions.message: Only one Glance backend could be selected.

images_vcenter.description: Configures Glance to use the vCenter/ESXi backend to store images. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
images_vcenter.label: VMware vCenter/ESXi datastore for images (Glance)

osd_pool_size.description: Configures the default number of object replicas in Ceph. This number must be equal to or lower than the number of deployed 'Ceph OSD' nodes.
osd_pool_size.label: Ceph object replication factor

restrictions.settings:storage.images_vcenter.value ==: Only one Glance backend could be selected.

images_ceph.description: Configures Glance to use the Ceph RBD backend to store images. If enabled, this option will prevent Swift from installing.
images_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for images (Glance)

hostname.description: Your DNS entries should point to this name. Self-signed certificates also will use this hostname
hostname.label: DNS hostname for public TLS endpoints

restrictions.settings:public_ssl.services.value == fa: TLS for OpenStack public endpoints should be enabled

horizon.description: Secure access to Horizon enabling HTTPS instead of HTTP
horizon.label: HTTPS for Horizon

services.description: Enable TLS termination on HAProxy for OpenStack services
services.label: TLS for OpenStack public endpoints

neutron_qos.description: Enable Neutron QoS advanced service plug-in
neutron_qos.label: Neutron QoS

restrictions.message: Neutron DVR must be disabled in order to use Neutron L3 HA

neutron_l3_ha.description:
Enable High Availability features for Virtual Routers in Neutron
Requires at least 2 Controller nodes to function properly
neutron_l3_ha.label: Neutron L3 HA

restrictions.networking_parameters:segmentation_type: DVR requires L2 population to be enabled.

neutron_dvr.description: Enable Distributed Virtual Routers in Neutron
neutron_dvr.label: Neutron DVR

neutron_l2_pop.description: Enable L2 population mechanism in Neutron
neutron_l2_pop.label: Neutron L2 population
